text: Table 2 Major risk factors for the development of peri-operative acute kidney injury. Patient Surgery Other Chronic diseases Emergency Acute illness Kidney Non-renal solid Sepsis organ transplant Heart failure Cardiac bypass Multi-organ time dysfunction Hypertension Aortic cross clamp Peripheral Nephrotoxic drugs arterial Obstructive ACEi pulmonary Diabetes ARB mellitus Alcoholism Diuretics Male Radio-opaque intravenous contrast Obesity Age (particularly > 65 years) ACE;, angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor; ARB, angio- tensin receptor blocker.
